name: Michael Carbin
content: Michael Carbin Associate Professor Massachusetts Institute of Technology Electrical Engineering and Computer Science Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory Head, Programming Systems Group CV : mcarbin@csail.mit.edu Research Interests I lead the MIT Programming Systems Group. My group investigates the design, semantics, and implementation of language-driven systems. We have a current focus on systems that operate in the presence of uncertainty in their environment (perception), implementation (neural networks or approximate transformations), or execution (unreliable hardware). Students Current Graduate Students and Post-Docs: Eric Atkinson, Ellie Cheng, Yi Ding, Jonathan Frankle, Tian Jin (co-advised with Jonathan Ragan-Kelley), Jesse Michel, Alexander Renda, Logan Weber (co-advised with Saman Amarasinghe), Cambridge Yang, Charles Yuan Current Undergraduate Students: Zachary Ankner Alumni: Brett Boston (MS, Galois), James Gilles (MEng, Reservoir Labs), Hyunji Kim (MEng, Stripe), Rajiv Movva (UG, Cornell Tech; PhD), Arlene Siswanto (MEng, Google Brain), Benjamin Sherman (PhD, Waymo), Sahil Verma (UG Visitor, University of Washington; PhD) Teaching Dynamic Computer Language Engineering (6.S081), Spring 2019 Dynamic Computer Language Engineering (6.S081), Spring 2018 Computer Language Engineering (6.035), Fall 2017 (Dynamic) Computer Language Engineering (6.035), Spring 2017 Computer Systems Engineering (6.033), Spring 2016 Service Program Committees: MLSys 2023 (Program Co-Chair), POPL 2022, OOPSLA 2021, ASPLOS 2021, ICLR 2021 (Area Chair), PLDI 2020, ICML 2020, NeurIPS 2020, ASPLOS 2020, SysML 2020, CGO 2019, EuroSys 2019, ECOOP 2018, USENIX ATC 2018, CGO 2018, PLDI 2017 (ERC), CGO 2017, OOPSLA 2016, PLDI 2016, CGO 2015 Awards MIT Frank E.
